result.execSummary:
The defendant Wade B. Bassatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.

Provide DNA sample.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Complete any specific programming determined appropriate by the DOC. 
Mental Health treatment.
Comply with all provisions imposed by Agent.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 3:19 Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: #2 and #3 were already deal with, time served. page 4 (prior record) has errors/additions/corrections. Victims rights have been complied with. Schwab: agrees to Ct#2 and Ct#3.  Froelich gives sentencing argument. asks for 10 years; 5 initial confinement and 5 ES. Atty Schwab gives sentencing argument. asks S/w probation with no conditional jail time. 304 days credit. Froelich objects. 3:41 Court recesses. 3:45 Court resumes. Froelich: agrees to 157 days credit. Court: 157 days credit. Schwab requests challenge incarceration/substance abuse program. Def addresses the court. Court: notes DOC recommends S/W 3 years probation with 6 months jail. Notes Ct#2 and Ct#3 were already dealt with. Court goes over sentencing factors. Court: 6 years total; 2.5 years initial confinement and 3.5 years ES. conditions: DNA sample and surcharge.Any programming deemed appropriate and any conditions implied by agent. No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. Mental Health treatment. Eligible Challenge incarceration program/substance abuse program.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 157 days credit.

03:53 Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in court, in custody. Student cert. attorney L. McMullen in court with Atty Liesl Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich requests warrant quashed, reinstate $5000 signature bond. Court orders $5000 signature bond reinstated, quashes warrant. 03:54

9:50  Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  Rory O Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in the Pepin Co jail and was not brought over for hearing.  Bench warrant is requested by OSullivan and court grants warrant.  Get new sentencing date set.

Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.

9:10  Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jurors are sworn. 20 jurors are seated. Judge calls the case.  Judge does general voir dire of the panel.  Atty OSullivan voir dires the panel.  Atty Schwab voir dires the panel. 4 strikes each. 12 are chosen and sworn. Recess 15 min.  10:07.
10:30 Court resumes with Attys and defendant present. 10:33  Jury returns to the courtroom. Judge gives the jury the preliminary instruction. Opening statement is given by Atty OSullivan.  Atty Schwab gives his opening statement. 10:55  Robby Jaeger is sw and ex by OSullivan.  Exh #1  Gun  offered and rec.   Schwab x-exams. Alison Meistad is sw and exam by OSullivan. Atty Schwab x-exams.  St of WI Anaylst Sara Zastrow-Arkens is sw and ex by OSullivan. Parties stipulate that Ms Zastriw-Arkens is an expert in this field. M16-722 Lab case number. Exh  2 State Crime Lab report offered and received.  Thomas Olszweski is sw and ex by OSullivan. Schwab x-exams.   OSullivan recalls Officer Jaeger.  Schwab x-exams.   Court informs the jury the stipulation the attorneys have agreed on regarding prior criminal convictions.  State rests 12:03  Jury is excused for lunch.   Attys and defendant are in the courtroom. Jury insturctions are discussed. The right to the defendant is also discussed. Break for lunch 12:08 
1:01 Court resumes Attys and defendant are in the courtroom.  Atty Schwab states the defendant will not be takings the witness stand.  Judge reviews the defendants right to testify on his own behalf.  Judge accepts the waiver of right to testify.  Jury and instruction conference is held. 140, 145, 103,157,148, 190,195,300,315 160,465,  Recess for 20 min.1:10 1:30 Court resumes  Attys, defendant and jury present. Closing arguement by OSullivan. 2:01  Jury is excused to deliberate. No exhibits to go to jury unless asked for.  Recess 2:02    2:59 Jury has a question  Attys and defendant are present. Judge rules on reply and sends it back to jury 3:08
3:19  Jury returns with a verdict.  Attys and defendant are present. 
Verdict -   Guilty of Ct 1.
Jury is excused  3:21    ATtys and defendant are present.  Court enters a judgment of guilty for Ct 1 based on the verdict of the jury  3:24
3:34  Attys and defendant present. Attorneys want a PSI and the case set for sentencing Court orders PSI and bond remains in effect.

8:52 This plea hearing is on Ct 2 and 3 of the information. Recomendation for sentencing is time served.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2 and Ct 3 of the information.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 & 3.  Court orders sentence to time served on Ct 2 & 3.

8:37  In the East Courtroom out of the presence of the jury.  The jury trial is on Ct 1 of the information. Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge addresses the defendant regarding his right to testify. Jury instructions are reviewed. Witness lists are reviewed. Courtroom procedure is reviewed with the attorneys. The parties have agreed that the analyst will appear by telephone.The gun may be brought into the courtroom and showed to the jury but not passed to the jury. Officer Jaeger is the court officer and will be at the table with Atty OSullivan.
from Atty Schwab re: Agreement with DA that Ct#1 will be tried and plea to Ct#2 and Ct#3
Motions in limine filed by D Schwab Froelich has no objection to. Motions are granted

11:16 Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: explanation for why there was a lack of communication.  Attorney Schwab: defendant in treatment program, since he has been out children have been here from out of state, treatment, overwhelmed with life. 11:15 <Attorney Schwab is excused from court room to take call from defendant's worker>. 11:19 Attorney Schwab returns. Attorney Schwab recommends calling worker. Court and Froelich agree.  Lynn Tentis, defendant's worker appears via phone, Ms. Tentis is sworn in.  Atty Schwab examines Ms. Tentis. Ms. Tentis responds. Froelich x-examines Ms. Tentis.  Court questions Ms. Tentis. Attorney Schwab asks follow up questions to Ms. Tentis. Froelich: assurances for working contact with the defendant, requests signature bond $2000, re-set jury trial date--set another status prior to trial date to ensure defendant is in contact with his attorney. Court: does not believe that defendant will come to jury trial, court orders $1000 cash bond. Atty Schwab may make demand for speedy trial. Parties to see JA for dates. 11:40

09:26 Defendant Wade B. Bassatt in court. Attorney Schwab appeared via phone. Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears an hour late, jurors summonsed to court, continued trial at a previous date due to attorney's inability to prepare for trial due to no contact with defendant. Court previously authorized a warrant at 6/9/16.  Froelich: wants explanation for as to why defendant has not been in contact with his attorney may request a high cash bond.  Attorney Schwab would like to talk to his defendant before addressing that on the record. Court would like to talk to defendant about only today's reason as to why he was late.  Froelich: allow the defendant and Attorney Schwab to speak, Froelich requests defendant to be booked into the jail, attorney Schwab will leave his office now and meet defendant in the jail. Defendant will be booked into jail. 09:34

08:42 Defendant Wade B. Bassatt not in court. Attorney Donald Schwab appears via phone with the court's permission.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court:  Atty Schwab still has not been able to contact the defendant.  Jury Trial was called off yesterday 6/8/16.  Froelich:  has checked throughout the court house, Froelich requests bench warrant be authorized. Court authorizes bench warrant and will sign upon presentation. 08:44

08:46 Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court: scheduled for jury trial on 6/9/16, Atty Schwab has not been able to contact defendant court still kept trial on calendar. Atty Schwab still has not been able to contact him, no voicemail available. Court cancels the Jury Trial scheduled for 6/9/16, Atty Schwab will be contacted tomorrow morning, if defendant is not here warrant may be authorized.

11:22  Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schwab states his client has disappeared. He has not been able to contact him. Attys request to take off the trial calendar. Judge wants the attys to wait until Wed morning to cancel this trial. Court will wait until Wed morning.
from Atty Schwab re: Motion in Limine was not heard at Final Pre-trial. Hear it the day of trial?

10:35 Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Wade Bassatt appeared via telephone with permission of the court. Atty Froelich states matter is unresolved, it is set for jury trial. Atty Schwab agrees. Court will keep this on trial calendar. 10:37.
